paper_abstract: A Direct Sum Theorem holds in a model of computation, when for every problem solving some k input instances together is k times as expensive as solving one. We show that Direct Sum Theorems hold in the models of deterministic and randomized decision trees for all relations. We also note that a near optimal Direct Sum Theorem holds for quantum decision trees for boolean functions. (C) 2010 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Optimal direct sum results for deterministic and randomized decision tree complexity
